modules.description: This module defines the core testing interface for asynchronous test cases, providing `run` and `run_with_args` to execute test suites with optional command-line arguments. It works with Lwt promises and Cmdliner terms, supporting both synchronous and asynchronous test functions that can receive setup values from the command line. Concrete use cases include writing test suites that perform I/O operations, handle concurrency, or require external configuration via CLI flags.

This module orchestrates testing for asynchronous functions returning Lwt promises, handling exceptions across concurrency boundaries and supporting both synchronous and asynchronous test cases. It integrates with Cmdliner to accept command-line arguments, enabling configurable test execution for scenarios like network services or file I/O. The `run` and `run_with_args` functions schedule test suites, allowing setup values to be passed from the command line. It directly supports Lwt-based concurrency and structured test composition with typed configurations.
